description:
The second season of Yakusoku no Neverland.

Fifteen children escape Grace Field House, a false paradise, hoping for a chance at freedom. Instead, they encounter plants and animals they have never before seen, and are chased by demons. The outside world is so beautiful, and yet is almost too cruel to face.

Even so, the children refuse to give up. They are guided in their search for better lives only by a message from Minerva and a pen Norman left behind in order to fulfill their promise to return to the House to save those of their family who are still trapped within.

(Source: Aniplex of America)

Note: Episode 1 streamed early on Amazon Prime on Jan 7, 2021. The regular TV broadcast started on Jan 8, 2021.
hashtag: #約束のネバーランド #約ネバ
synonyms: พันธสัญญาเนเวอร์แลนด์ ภาค 2
約定的夢幻島 第二季

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

name.native: ジェイムズ・ラートリー
alternative: William Minerva (ウィリアム・ミネルヴァ)

node.description:
Kaiu Shirai (白井カイウ) (a pseudonym) is a manga writer.

After graduating from university, Shirai worked in a company.

Shirai has published two one-shot books including "Poppy's Wish" ("Poppy no Negai", 2016) with the illustrator Posuka Demizu.

Since 2016, Shirai has been collaborating with Posuka Demizu on the series "The Promised Neverland" ("Yakusoku no Neverland"), a manga published in the Weekly Shonen Jump.
The series sold more than 3 million copies in Japan in its first seven volumes and won the 63rd Shogakukan Prize in the Shōnen category. It was adapted as an anime in 2019.

The bookstore "L'Ange Bleu" in Périgny, awarded to the Volume 1 of "The Promised Neverland" the 2019 Mangawa Prize in the Shōnen category. The Volume 7 is the winner of the 2019 Babelio Manga Prize.

[Website](http://posuka.iinaa.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/demizuposuka)

A freelance artist. She made her debut in 2008 with a mini-series published in the manga prepublication magazine Corocoro.

"The Art of Posuka Demizu", her first artbook that gathers her drawings, was published in 2016.
He formerly worked at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) and is currently working at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.
He formerly worked at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) and is currently working at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

[Official Website](https://www.akiyamakiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ilikeakairo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCisiBQyQ7SsHC1M5-IZgwFA)

__Birthplace:__ Utsunomiya City, Tochigi Prefecture, Japan

Kiro Akiyama is a Japanese male solo artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/myukmusic) | [YouTube](https://youtube.com/c/myukmusic) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/myukmusic/)

__Birthplace:__ Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan

Miyu Kumagawa is a Japanese singer, songwriter, and lyricist. Miyu's songs are mostly inspired by western music artists like Ed Sheeran and Taylor Swift. In the beginning of her career, she started producing music mainly on acoustic guitar and perform mostly covers on services like Spotify or J-WAVE. In the end of 2020, she started her solo music project "Myuk", and under this name, she and composer EVE prepared the first song for the anime series _Yakusoku no Neverland Season 2_.

The name "Myuk" comes from the Swedish word "Mjuk", which means "gentleness," and her real name (Miyu K).

__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__

__Introduction:__
Eve is a Japanese utaite, mangaka, fashion designer, vocalist, guitarist, lyricist and composer under record label TOY'S FACTORY (2019–), having previously been under record label harapeco records (2016–2018). He works closely with the arranger [Tomoki Numano](https://anilist.co/staff/137906/Tomoki-Numano), otherwise known as Numa, who arranges most of his songs.

__Biography:__
He first started uploading covers on NicoNico Douga in April 2009 at the age of 13. Aside from covering songs, he was one of the lead singers for the Japanese indie band einie, alongside Natsushiro Takaaki; he also composed songs and wrote lyrics for the band. 

He started going by the name Eve in October 2009; before that, he had gone by the names Keitora and Kurowa. He also plays the acoustic guitar and sometimes accompanies his songs with his own acoustic arrangements.

__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__
